message.content: {"id": "3622", "title": "Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message", "description": "When invoking the New Java Package wizard and before typing anything, a message appears at the top stating 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'. This message is unclear and confusing because the package name field is empty at this point. It is unclear whether this is an error or a warning. It is suggested that if this message is indeed an error, it should be displayed in red with the error icon. Additionally, when the package name field is empty, there should be no error message and the 'Finish' button should be disabled. It is also important to note that there seems to be an issue with creating a default package as it can't be created by the user since it always exists.", "OB": "When invoking the New Java Package wizard and before typing anything, a message appears at the top stating 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'. This message is confusing when the package name field is empty.", "EB": "The confusing message stating 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' should be removed or clarified to provide better guidance. The error message should be displayed in red with the appropriate error icon, if it is indeed an error. When the package name field is empty, there should be no error message and the 'Finish' button should be disabled. It should be possible for the user to create a default package during the creation of a new Java project.", "SR": "To reproduce the issue: 1. Create a new Java Project. 2. Select the project. 3. Open the New Package Wizard."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '3622', 'title': 'Bug 3622New Package Wizard has confusing message (1GD0L9O)', 'description': 'Bug 3622New Package Wizard has confusing message (1GD0L9O) ', 'OB': 'Invoke New Java Package.Result: Before you type anything the following message appears at the top: "A foldercorresponding to the package name already exists".At this point my package name fieldis empty.What does this message mean?Is this an error?If so, should it be displayed inred with the error icon?NOTES:EG (5/1/2001 5:53:41 AM)there should be no error message when the package name field is empty andfinish should be disabled.MA (5/2/01 9:34:00 AM)It is a warning.I will remove the messageEG (5/2/01 9:43:44 AM)issue how to create a default package?It can\'t be created by the user since it always there. ', 'EB': '', 'SR': 'Create a new Java Project2. Select the project.3. '}
